Package Maze

Enum Class Directions

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<Directions>
Maze.Directions
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Directions>, Constable
public enum Directions extends Enum<Directions>
The Directions enum enumerates the 4 directions (NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST). This is used for calculating the valid cells from which a solver can travel to another cell

  • Field Details

    • xOffset

      private final int xOffset
      The x, y offset of a given direction. The values it can take: 0,1,-1. bValue: The bit values corresponding to a height

    • yOffset

      private final int yOffset
      The x, y offset of a given direction. The values it can take: 0,1,-1. bValue: The bit values corresponding to a height

    • bValue

      private final int bValue
      The x, y offset of a given direction. The values it can take: 0,1,-1. bValue: The bit values corresponding to a height

    • getOffsetDirection

      public static Directions getOffsetDirection(int x0, int y0, int x1, int y1)
      Calculates the offset direction from the given coordinates relative to the current cell.
      Parameters:
      x0 - The x coordinate of the first cell
      y0 - The y coordinate of the first cell
      x1 - The x coordinate of the second cell
      y1 - The y coordinate of the second cell
      Returns:
      The relative direction of neighbouring cell from source.

    • turnSideways

      public static Directions turnSideways(Directions d, boolean positive)
      Calculates a new direction which is perpendicular to the current one.
      Parameters:
      d - The current direction which we face
      positive - Determines if we turn clockwise of counter-clockwise
      Returns:
      a new direction perpendicular to the passed direction

    • getDirectionFromValue

      public static Directions getDirectionFromValue(int bValue)
      Every direction has a corresponding int value. These values are the powers of two, as they are supposed to represent single bits in a four bit number. This method returns the correct constant.
      Parameters:
      bValue - int value of the direction
      Returns:
      a direction corresponding to the passed bValue
